title: U.S. Millennials : most popular social network 2016 , by age group
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Platforms for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34 that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 3 groups, 30-34 had the highest Share of respondents in Platform Facebook and 25-29 had the lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
In Platform Facebook, 18-24 had the highest Share of respondents among all 7 Platforms and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
The maximum Share of respondents for 18-24 that was found in Platform Facebook was 12.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Platform Twitter.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Platforms for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34 that are presented on the X-axis.
Platform Facebook had the maximum Share of respondents among all 3 groups, and it was for 30-34. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Platform Twitter for 25-29.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 7 different Platforms for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34 that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 3 groups, 30-34 had the highest Share of respondents in Platform Facebook and 25-29 had the lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
In Platform Facebook, 18-24 had the highest Share of respondents among all 7 Platforms and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
The maximum Share of respondents for 18-24 that was found in Platform Facebook was 12.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Platform Twitter.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 7 different Platforms on X-axis for 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Platform Facebook had the maximum Share of respondents among all 3 groups, and it was for 30-34. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Platform Twitter for 25-29.
In Platform Facebook, 18-24 had the highest Share of respondents among all 7 Platforms and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Platform Twitter.
The maximum Share of respondents for 18-24 that was found in Platform Facebook was 12.0 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Platform Twitter.
Among all 3 groups, 25-29 had the gap of 40.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents observed in Platform Facebook and Twitter respectively.
30-34 had the maximum Share of respondents out of all 3 groups in Platform Facebook followed by 30-34 in Facebook, and the minimum Share of respondents is found for 25-29 in Twitter.
On average, the Platform Facebook had the highest Share of respondents for all 3 groups 18-24, 25-29, and 30-34. Whereas Twitter had the lowest average Share of respondents.
